issue_name: Threat Actor Leverages Compromised Account of Former Employee to Access State Government Organization

1.description: Determine the necessity of current administrator accounts and only maintain those essential for network management.

2.command: Restrict the use of multiple administrator accounts
2.description: Limit the use of multiple administrator accounts for one user.

3.description: Create separate administrator accounts for on-premises and Azure environments to segment access.

4.command: Implement the principle of least privilege
4.description: Enable just-in-time and just enough access for administrator accounts to elevate the minimum necessary privileges for a limited time to complete tasks.

5.description: Implement phishing-resistant MFA for remote access and access to any sensitive data repositories.

6.command: Establish policy and procedure for the prompt removal of unnecessary accounts
6.description: Ensure accounts of offboarded employees are removed and can no longer access the network.

7.command: Maintain a robust asset management policy
7.description: Track current version information to maintain awareness of outdated software and map assets to business and critical functions.

8.description: Regularly patch all operating systems, applications, and software to mitigate the potential for exploitation.

9.command: Restrict personal devices from connecting to the network
9.description: Ensure personal devices are not subject to the same group policies and security measures as domain joined devices.

10.command: Evaluate current user permissions in the Azure tenant
10.description: Restrict potentially harmful permissions including users' ability to register applications and create tenants.

11.command: Restrict access to the Azure AD portal to administrators only
11.description: Ensure only administrators can access the Azure AD portal to prevent unauthorized viewing of user info, group info, device details, and user privileges.

12.description: Enable complete coverage of tools, including Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), across the environment for thorough analysis of anomalous activity and remediation of potential vulnerabilities.

13.command: Use tools that identify attack paths
13.description: Enable defenders to identify common attack paths used by threat actors and shut them down before they are exploited.

14.command: Review the security recommendations list provided by Microsoft 365 Defender
14.description: Focus remediation on critical vulnerabilities on endpoints that are essential to mission execution and contain sensitive data.

15.description: Determine if changes are necessary to current conditional access policies.

16.description: Employ strong password management alongside other attribute-based information, such as device information, time of access, user history, and geolocation data.

17.command: Store credentials in a secure manner
17.description: Use a credential manager, vault, or other privileged account management solution to store credentials securely.
